entry.et: Middle English gurle, girle young person of either sex

def.dt: :a female child from birth to adulthood
:a single or married woman of any age
:a female assistant (as in an office) entrusted with a wide variety of tasks
:a member of a worldwide scouting movement for girls 7 to 18 years of age that is equivalent to the Girl Scouts in the United States
:a member of any of the scouting programs of the Girl Scouts of the United States of America for girls ages 5 through 17
:a female attendant who retrieves balls for players or officials (as in a tennis match or a baseball or basketball game)
:a girl or woman employed to look after the equipment (as bats) of a baseball team
:a woman who entertains bar patrons and encourages them to spend freely
:a prostitute with whom an appointment may be made by telephone

entry.et: from Camp Fire Girls, Inc., former name of Camp Fire, Inc.

def.dt: :a girl who is a member of a national organization of young people from ages 5 to 18
:a young woman who sings or dances in the chorus of a theatrical production (as a musical or revue)
